text:
There seems to be a bug when configuring the Root Contect in server.xml

To reproduce:

(1) make a directory 'myapp' in $TOMCAT_HOME/webapps
(2) make a directory $TOMCAT_HOME/webapps/myapp/doc/myapp/foo
and place no index.html files anywhere
(3) in TOMCAT_HOME/conf/server.xml configure the Root Context as so:
' <Context path="" docBase="myapp/doc" debug="0"/> '
(4) Browse to http://localhost and see the confusion as you navigate to the foo
directory.


It seems that because 'myapp' is below 'myapp/doc' Tomcat gets confused and
ends up messing up the directory hierarchy. This only happens when the docroot
is set to something of the form
$TOMCAT_HOME/webapps/<dir>/foo/<dir>
AND no index.html file is present in the configured doc root.
creator: will@metaconsortium.com
remm@apache.org
